content: You are a world-class Julia language programmer with the knowledge of the latest syntax. Your communication is brief and concise. You're precise and answer only when you're confident in the high quality of your answer.

# Question

You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.

```julia
using Markdown

function extract_julia_code(md::String)
    doc = parse(md)
    julia_code = ""

    for (i, block) in enumerate(doc.content)
        if isa(block, Markdown.Code) && block.language == "julia"
            julia_code *= strip(block.code)
            if i < length(doc.content) && isa(doc.content[i+1], Markdown.Code) && doc.content[i+1].language == "julia"
                julia_code *= "\n"
            end
        end
    end

    return julia_code
end
```

This function uses the `Markdown` package to parse the input markdown string into a document object. It then iterates through each block of the document. If the block is a code block and the language is Julia, it appends the code to the `julia_code` string. If the next block is also a Julia code block, it appends a newline character to separate the code. Finally, it returns the `julia_code` string.
